answers.answer: I was told that my son was over 8lbs from an ultrasound at 38 weeks and he was born 6.5. They do not have highly accurate ways of measuring weight in utero, so he may not be huge. Did the doctor say at what point they would want to do a c-section?
No I'm not scheduled for a C-section my doctor is trying to get me to deliver normal I have pregnancy diabetes that's why my baby is so big and you're right it's not accurate I've been told.
Hopefully by 38 weeks they'll induce me at least I hope lol
Oh yeah, if you have GD they'll induce if he gets too large. They don't generally do a section for that.
Yeah hopefully they do it soon when are you due?
I'm due the 9th, I'm guessing that's probably a few days after you?
Yeah just a couple of days after I'm due on the 6th
Those measurements aren't accurate. They were over a pound off on my first son. A friend of mine said they were 2 pounds off on her baby. Don't worry! :)

question: So my baby boy was breech all my pregnancy and finally today at 35weeks he flipped into position which my doctor saw threw sonogram I was so worried about getting a C-section I was relieved when they told me the good news in today's visit now the only thing is that my baby is 7 lbs 5oz a little to big he's measuring two weeks ahead I'm scared that he'll grow to big to have him vaginally and I'll end up getting a C-section anyway my doctor told me I'm getting induced at 39 weeks but that's still 4 weeks from now I hope he doesn't grow to big within those 4 weeks I don't know what to expect?
title: Baby to big
